description: Adds one or more nodes to a DAX cluster.

parameters.name: ClusterName
parameters.description: The name of the DAX cluster that will receive additional nodes.

parameters.name: NewReplicationFactor
parameters.description: The new number of nodes for the DAX cluster.

parameters.name: AvailabilityZones
parameters.description: The Availability Zones (AZs) in which the cluster nodes will be created. All nodes belonging to the cluster are placed in these Availability Zones. Use this parameter if you want to distribute the nodes across multiple AZs. (string) ---

nested_items.name: ClusterName
nested_items.description: The name of the DAX cluster.

nested_items.name: Description
nested_items.description: The description of the cluster.

nested_items.name: ClusterArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies the cluster.

nested_items.name: TotalNodes
nested_items.description: The total number of nodes in the cluster.

nested_items.name: ActiveNodes
nested_items.description: The number of nodes in the cluster that are active (i.e., capable of serving requests).

nested_items.name: NodeType
nested_items.description: The node type for the nodes in the cluster. (All nodes in a DAX cluster are of the same type.)

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: The current status of the cluster.

nested_items.name: ClusterDiscoveryEndpoint
nested_items.description: The endpoint for this DAX cluster, consisting of a DNS name, a port number, and a URL. Applications should use the URL to configure the DAX client to find their cluster.

nested_items.name: Address
nested_items.description: The DNS hostname of the endpoint.

nested_items.name: Port
nested_items.description: The port number that applications should use to connect to the endpoint.

nested_items.name: URL
nested_items.description: The URL that applications should use to connect to the endpoint. The default ports are 8111 for the 'dax' protocol and 9111 for the 'daxs' protocol.

nested_items.name: NodeIdsToRemove
nested_items.description: A list of nodes to be removed from the cluster.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: Nodes
nested_items.description: A list of nodes that are currently in the cluster.

nested_items.name: NodeId
nested_items.description: A system-generated identifier for the node.

nested_items.name: Address
nested_items.description: The DNS hostname of the endpoint.

nested_items.name: Port
nested_items.description: The port number that applications should use to connect to the endpoint.

nested_items.name: URL
nested_items.description: The URL that applications should use to connect to the endpoint. The default ports are 8111 for the 'dax' protocol and 9111 for the 'daxs' protocol.

nested_items.name: NodeCreateTime
nested_items.description: The date and time (in UNIX epoch format) when the node was launched.

nested_items.name: AvailabilityZone
nested_items.description: The Availability Zone (AZ) in which the node has been deployed.

nested_items.name: NodeStatus
nested_items.description: The current status of the node. For example: available.

nested_items.name: ParameterGroupStatus
nested_items.description: The status of the parameter group associated with this node. For example, in-sync.

nested_items.name: PreferredMaintenanceWindow
nested_items.description: A range of time when maintenance of DAX cluster software will be performed. For example: sun:01:00-sun:09:00. Cluster maintenance normally takes less than 30 minutes, and is performed automatically within the maintenance window.

nested_items.name: NotificationConfiguration
nested_items.description: Describes a notification topic and its status. Notification topics are used for publishing DAX events to subscribers using Amazon Simple Notification Service (SNS).

nested_items.name: TopicArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that identifies the topic.

nested_items.name: TopicStatus
nested_items.description: The current state of the topic. A value of 'active' means that notifications will be sent to the topic. A value of 'inactive' means that notifications will not be sent to the topic.

nested_items.name: SubnetGroup
nested_items.description: The subnet group where the DAX cluster is running.

nested_items.name: SecurityGroups
nested_items.description: A list of security groups, and the status of each, for the nodes in the cluster.

nested_items.name: SecurityGroupIdentifier
nested_items.description: The unique ID for this security group.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: The status of this security group.

nested_items.name: IamRoleArn
nested_items.description: A valid Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that identifies an IAM role. At runtime, DAX will assume this role and use the role's permissions to access DynamoDB on your behalf.

nested_items.name: ParameterGroup
nested_items.description: The parameter group being used by nodes in the cluster.

nested_items.name: ParameterGroupName
nested_items.description: The name of the parameter group.

nested_items.name: ParameterApplyStatus
nested_items.description: The status of parameter updates.

nested_items.name: NodeIdsToReboot
nested_items.description: The node IDs of one or more nodes to be rebooted.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: SSEDescription
nested_items.description: The description of the server-side encryption status on the specified DAX cluster.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: The current state of server-side encryption:
ENABLING - Server-side encryption is being enabled.
ENABLED - Server-side encryption is enabled.
DISABLING - Server-side encryption is being disabled.
DISABLED - Server-side encryption is disabled.

nested_items.name: ClusterEndpointEncryptionType
nested_items.description: The type of encryption supported by the cluster's endpoint. Values are:
NONE for no encryption TLS for Transport Layer Security.
